title: DT_RUNPATH produced in binary with `rpath = true` is wrong

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-cargo
labels.description: Relevant to the cargo team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
STR:
1. Clone https://github.com/staktrace/cbindgen and check out the `rpath_bug` branch (the relevant change in this branch is that it sets `rpath = true` in the dev/release profiles in `Cargo.toml`.
2. Run `cargo build`
3. Run `target/debug/cbindgen`. Observe that it produces an error that it can't find the libproc_macro shared library
4. `mkdir target/debug/subfolder && mv target/debug/cbindgen target/debug/subfolder/`
5. Now run `target/debug/subfolder/cbindgen`. Observe that it runs without the error

If you run `readelf -d target/debug/cbindgen | grep RUNPATH` you'll see something like this:

```
 0x000000000000001d (RUNPATH)            Library runpath: [$ORIGIN/../../../../../.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib:/home/kats/zspace/cbindgen/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib]
```

The important part here is that the path relative to $ORIGIN is wrong, there is one too many `../`. That's why moving the binary into a subfolder works while running it where it is does not. I'm not really sure why this is generated using a relative path anyway, IMO it should be absolute so that it works no matter where it's placed. It seems excessively brittle to make it relative (and based on this bug, I don't see how it's of any value to anybody right now).

Note that I discovered this problem while attempting to find a workaround for #47931 which might provide more useful context.
